title: Salt: A World History
description: A sweeping history of how salt shaped civilizations, economies, wars, diets, and global trade, revealing how a simple mineral transformed human culture.

title: Modernist Cuisine
authors: Nathan Myhrvold, Chris Young, and Maxime Bilet
description: An encyclopedic exploration of culinary science, demonstrating the physics, chemistry, and innovation behind modern cooking techniques.

title: The Omnivore's Dilemma
description: An investigation into how food choices reveal our relationship with nature, exploring industrial agriculture, organic farming, and hunter-gatherer food systems.

title: Kitchen Confidential
description: A raw and revealing memoir detailing life inside professional kitchens and the gritty realities of the culinary world.

title: On Food and Cooking: The Science and Lore of the Kitchen
description: A foundational scientific reference explaining what happens to food as it cooks, transforming culinary knowledge through chemistry and biology.

title: Animal, Vegetable, Miracle
description: A nonfiction account of one family's journey to eat only locally grown food, examining sustainability and the social impact of agriculture.

title: Taste: My Life Through Food
description: A personal memoir celebrating food, family, and heritage, exploring how meals shape identity and memory.

title: The Taste of Country Cooking
description: A seminal work documenting Southern culinary traditions, preserving regional recipes and cultural history through food.

title: The Third Plate
description: An exploration of how chefs, farmers, and scientists can reshape the future of food by integrating ecology, sustainability, and culinary creativity.

title: Heat
description: A narrative about the author's immersion into professional cooking, learning directly from chefs and discovering the art, culture, and obsession behind cuisine.
